results.title: The Creepy Crawley's
results.creator_credit: Citt Williams, Beck Cole and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
The Creepy Crawleys, a documentary film, is set in an isolated Australian country town and tells the story of Monte Cristo, a mysterious old mansion and its owners, past and present.
Contains b&w archival stills.
results.description:

results.title: Arcadia
results.creator_credit: Greg Waters, Paola Garofali, Adrian Wills and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
‘I know that you’re there, because I can feel you. Why don’t you come out and play with me. In the dark I hear you breathing. Watch out for the Hairy Man…’
In Arcadia nothing is what it seems.
Cast: Hunter Page, Justine Saunders, Ursula Yovich, Damien Garvey, Pauline Lampton
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Waters, Paola Garofali, Adrian Wills and AFTRS

results.title: The Third note
results.creator_credit: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Priscilla Collins, Catriona McKenzie and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A blind woman and her Russian neighbour do battle with sound and music when he refuses to read a postcard for her. What starts as war ends in understanding.
Cast: Deborah Mailman, Leonid Dobrinski

Cast: Deborah Mailman, Leonid Dobrinski
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Priscilla Collins, Catriona McKenzie and AFTRS

results.title: You dust mite be next
results.creator_credit: Darlene Johnson, Chris Aronsten, Kate Reidl, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A docudrama about the evil little dust mite that plagues the world using up close and personal microscopic images, horror tales from victims and a biology lesson from experts Dr Ewan Tovey and Michael Morris.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darlene Johnson, Chris Aronsten, Kate Reidl, Jane Keneally and AFTRS

results.title: Redreaming the dark
results.creator_credit: Romaine Moreton, Charlotte Seymour, Erica Glynn and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
During an electricity blackout in the family apartment, a young intellectually challenged Black woman has her life suddenly thrown into turmoil. Her grandmother soothes the young girl, teaching her not only to embrace the dark but also to love her dark self. Together the three women “redream” the dark.
Cast: Emily Walker, Leah Purcell, Irma Woods
results.creator_credit_for_label: Romaine Moreton, Charlotte Seymour, Erica Glynn and AFTRS

results.title: Two bob mermaid
results.creator_credit: Darlene Johnson, Antonia Barnard and Core Films
results.brief_description: In this visually stunning short film set in the 1950s, a fair-skinned Aboriginal girl gains access to the local swimming pool where Aboriginal people are legally denied access (Source: Australian Screen)

results.title: My colour, your kind
results.brief_description: A young girl, incarcerated in a dormitory, escapes to her rightful place in the world. During the journey she recollects her life and the treatment she has endured. In My Colour, Your Kind director Danielle Mclean uses her experience as a fair skinned Aborigine to explore the notion of Aboriginal identity.
results.description: A young girl, incarcerated in a dormitory, escapes to her rightful place in the world. During the journey she recollects her life and the treatment she has endured. results.title: My bed, your bed
results.brief_description: In an isolated community, a man and woman are promised under the traditional laws of marriage. The time has come for Delia and Alvin to move in together. Things don’t turn out as smoothly as they might. My Bed, Your Bed explores notions of Aboriginal identity through an examination of the ways that Aboriginal people living in Central Australian bush communities adopt values from both contemporary and traditional works.

results.title: Journey (Sen)
results.brief_description: A young boy leaves his isolated home town hitching across a forever changing landscape. His travels cause him to relive fragments of the life left behind as he struggles to find rest in a journey that may never end. An award winning short from Indigenous filmmaker Ivan Sen whose other films include Tears, Wind and Dust.
